org.qbroker.jms

Class EventTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.qbroker.jms.EventTracker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventEscalation

    public class EventTracker
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventEscalation
    EventTracker aggregates incoming events and keeps tracking their state according to the predefined policies and the content of the aggregated events. In case of the state changes up to the escalation point, it generates a new event as the escalation and returns it. EventTracker maitains the session for all aggregated events. The session will expire if it reaches the expiration time, or reset by certain incoming events. If the Type is set to MessageTracker, it will return a TextEvent as a JMS Message.

    EventTracker caches the aggregated events based on their keys and the shared TimeToLive. If the cached time for the key exceeds the TTL, it will be expired and a new event will be generated for aggregation.

    EventTracker implements EventEscalation. It provides a way for us to correlate events across the time line.
    Author:
    yannanlu@yahoo.com

      • getEscalationOrder

        public int getEscalationOrder()
        Description copied from interface: EventEscalation
        It returns an integer as the escalation order that determines if the escalation event to be processed before the original event or not. If the escalation order is ORDER_FISRT, the escalation event should be processed before the original event. If it is ORDER_LAST, the escalation event should be processed after. If it is ORDER_NONE, which one is the first does not matter.
        Specified by:
        getEscalationOrder in interface EventEscalation
